text:
An expression of disgust crossed the young man's face. 

He was handsome, tall, and slim. 

His dark eyes held shadows of thought. 

He walked, lost in a blank mind. 

Occasionally, he muttered to himself. 

“I’m weak,” he admitted, hunger gnawing at him. 

His clothes were rags, unfit for the street. 

Yet, in this part of town, few cared. 

Bitterness filled his heart. 

He hated meeting acquaintances. 

A drunken man in a wagon passed by. 

The young man glanced, then looked away.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The young man, despite his handsome appearance, is consumed by disgust and bitterness, reflecting on his dire circumstances and the rags he wears.
